Review Text: Wow! i am opportuned to stay in this hotel, i was there in may and july, i had my wedding photo shoot there and i also had my wedding in their hall. the place and staff was home away from home. I would like to recognize some of the staff that stood out even though all the staff stood out to be honest. i do not like giving review especially when i feel the stay was horrible but this place stood out after being away for years i still had a good experience there. I would first like to recognize the GM which i learned is new Richardo (italian man, married to akwa ibom) i complained about the breakfast because it was chicken sauce and i do not eat chicken and right away they made fish sauce for me, we complained about the rooms that had cockroaches and right away they took care of

I checked in late as I was flying out the following day. The hotel is centrally located and close to the airport. I received normal hospitality welcome on my arrival. I checked in and had a very pleasant meal.

De Santo hotel is a nice place to visit and have your secured holiday or business trip without any fear,they got tight security I ever wondered 2 mopol on duty each day.The manager Mr Olu and staff at deck Miriam with prince will they are all wonderful and got good customer service that will make me come bk to the hotel

The hotel is one of the best in Lagos..... I really enjoyed my stay with my families from aboard and home,I will like you guys to also enjoy a visit to the hotel to know how beautiful standard and nice the hotel is,swimming pool,bar,suitable environment etc

I came to view the hotel including the rooms as I was planning on using it for my wedding in December but I was not allowed to view the rooms which I found strange. However I decided to lodge here for 2 nights to have a first hand experience of the hotel and its room. I would say it's an amazing hotel and Miriam at the reception was simply one of the best receptionist I have ever experienced, she was full of smiles and so helpful. She is a big credit to this hotel. The rooms were very clean, and smelt very nice. The only negatives were the bathroom hot water was not coming out, and also the TV didnt have as much stations as I thought it will but all the same, I'd definitely stay at this hotel again and will be making a big reservation for my wedding in December. Thanks to all

The hotel services are splendid.my grand parents spent a week there without issues or complains.I also appreciate the wonderful receptionist MARIAM who always attended to us promptly.Thank you MARIAM.we would visit another time

Review Title: My 14 nights at De Santos hotel
Review Text: My husband & me spent 2 weeks at this hotel. The travel agency recommended this hotel to me for "Oyinbos" in Lagos. I've got to say that since the very beginning the recepcionists: Miriam & Charity were pretty nice to us. Porters were very kind too: Samuel and Sundary. About the hotel room was cleaned every single day, it's true I have to tell to use insecticide to prevent from mosquitoes, but they did it for sure: Michael, Kingslery, Ucho and Begi. They changed our towels & sheets too. Staff at the restaurant was quite nice as well, my special thanks to: Ifeany and Wisdom. She always adviced me what to eat and was polite, he always tried to do his best while the room service & was patient. Excellent and plenty buffet breakfast, as well as the special dinners on the weekends.

Review Title: my week end stay at the santos hotel lagos
Review Text: the hotel in terms of structure is one of the best in akowonjo and quite peaceful and best for young couples because of its activities , club, gym, pool, event center close to both local and international airport.
Room Tips: the room at the top floors far from the reception is better for weekend stay overs because of...

Review Title: Run, don't walk -- as far away from this place as you can!
Review Text: Very noisy -- right in the flight path of the airplanes...yet it takes almost 1 1/2 hours to get to the airport by road.  Not safe enough to walk around anywhere, and the service (and food) at the hotel is horrible.  Everything in the bathroom was broken (there wasn't even a toilet seat).  Very uncomfortable stay.

We got the hotel recommended by a friend who stayed there too as we previously stayed at the Ibis Ikeja. De Santos is quite cheaper and in a much quieter area. We liked the big room and friendly staff. We had our best meal during our 2 weeks trip through Nigeria there. Spicy shredded chicken and jollof rice, amazing!!the pool area is cozy with a pool table
Review Text

The De Santos hotl was quite nice. I have a stomach condition and I can not eat chilli (pepper in nigeria). Bless the staff. They tried to help but they couldn't cook anything with chilli. The stay was comfortable and the staff tried to help

We held a conference in one their Hall and we took some rooms, the experience was good. I highly recommend the hotel  because they have good ambiance and well trained staff and it located close to the airport.

My stay in this hotel will be a memorable experience for years to come. They offer excellent services ranging from the 24 hours power supply, top notch facilities, conducive and serene environment, and friendly staff. I indeed enjoyed my stay and hope to be back again pretty soon.

If I am to rate De santos hotel Awka, i will give them a Four star Standard. Their rooms, paintings, Decorations, pool side, Restaurant and bar, all is superb. Very Unique and relaxing environment. So as the other branch in Dopemu Lagos very close to Local and international Airport Kudos to you guyz, will definitely see you guyz again soon.

I loved the atmosphere and ambiance of the hotel and also the hotel staff were very welcoming with smiles on their faces, I had a wonderfull time with my family,and also great internet service,it was a good experience.

Review Title: Very nice place, perfect for your relax!
Review Text: I stayed with my husband and my baby child in this hotel for three weeks, from the first day to the last day the staff was always courteous, well-mannered and always ready to satisfy your request. Room cleaned every day, the restaurant and bar high quality (just for me I 'am European too too much pepper I ask many times for dishes without pepper but they didn't understand the meaning no pepper so I didn't order anymore),  for breakfast the chef should prepare something else then Nigerian food, some cookies or croissant ..I eated every days bread and butter ,about this I am sorry..the pool as well was cleaned every day and all available every day. Next year when we'll come back to Lagos we will come to De Santos hotel.Thanks  to all staff!  Samuel family

I have stayed in de santos on and off over the past two/three years since I came across it and have never been disappointed by their standards. I initially thought they might have trouble maintaining their standard over the years but my last stay proved me wrong. I think they are here to stay and deliver the best. I was getting married and needed a first class hotel to lodge my guests as some of them would be coming from outside Nigeria and I needed to be sure of their safety and comfort without breaking the bank. They were all pleased with the service and comfort they got in Nigeria and this was largely due to the support and service rendered by De Santos. I also stayed there for a few days after the wedding with my husband and I must say, It holds a very memorable period of my

Roaches in the room complained to the staff they said the room was sprayed roaches continue in the room was one towel asked for another as we booked the room as a couple they said it was company policy to only give one towel per room we checked out after the second night and checked into another hotel for the other 7 night stay in Lagos we will never visit De santos hotel again the bathroom was also very dirty such a dirty roach infested room.

I really had a fab experience in this hotel sometimes last year when my team hitted our sales target and decided to celebrate in this hotel....., good foods.....good people....excellent security. Will check in again soon

I’ve spent quite a few decades in the U.K. … Akowonjo is where I was born and spent my early growing up years. I could remember friends suggesting Ikeja (mainland) for classic / standard hotels whenever I am in Nigeria.  3 years ago, I was introduced to a new hotel in Akowonjo. At first, I’m a bit skeptical about it until I entered the premises and noticed a hotel of a world of its own! It’s proximity to the Airport and to my family house (where my elderly parents now reside) caught my fancy instantly. The ambience / serenity of the environment and the professional way things are being handled really impressed me.  On my second visit, I thought the excitement of this new hotel would’ve faded like most Nig hotels with problems like lack of management and maintenance, but I was
Review Text

Ok I got to say last time I visited this hotel it had a good service and was looking forward visiting nigeria again to stay in the same hotel, this was when the hotel newly opened. I checked in march 2016 and I have to say was not impressed at all. I was given a small standard room saying it was a deluxe room. My bathroom was outdated. With a bucket I really don't know what that was for. You get only one coffee cup and when  I asked for another they said u only get one in the room but the room was booked for two. No glasses. Staines on the duvet. No information on who to call when  need anything. The break fast was rubbish. U got only 2 choices boiled potatoes and dry sausages with baked beans.  I was to stay for a week but check out the next day. I will NEVER visit this hotel

My friends and I really enjoyed our stay here and we indeed got value for our money. The staffs are very friendly, the Rooms are really comfortable with complimentary wifi, the meals are also very nice. They have live band at the poolside with other activities to always keep you satisfied. T'was really a wonderful experience and will definitely love to come back again.

The spacious rooms were of high standard overall. Clean, facilities good. Excellent for our purpose, the staffs are well cultured  and customer friendly, we really enjoyed the complimentary meals and the live band @ the pool site. De Santos hotel is one of the best hotel in Lagos.

Review Title: The experience remains the same, great!
Review Text: My family and I were here July last year and it was a wonderful experience. We stayed in the Suite this time and were welcomed with a basket-full of assorted fresh fruits. Rooms were large. This hotel has been a home for us anytime we're in Nigeria. Facilities are still clean, neat and well maintained. 24 hours power supply, non-stop! The gym was great for a nice work-out. I noticed upgraded services this time. Staff were very friendly as usual. As for the food, it was still ok. Complimentary breakfast buffet varies every morning. The overall services were still great, but there's always room for greater improvement to avoid being stale. For us, De Santos Hotel remains the best around the area coupled with its proximity to both the International / local airports. I can say that

Wow! I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The environment was very clean, the room also. There's free internet and other complimentary services like the gym, the breakfast etc...There services are excellent and the staff very friendly.

I checked into this hotel 2 years ago when i was in the country and it was good so decided to try it again.  but this time i got a shock. I checked in and asked for a dexule room but was given a standard room saying all room are the same. I got to my room it was too small comared to the dexule room i tool last time. The room had insects. The duxet had staines. There was no towels no glasses and only one tea cup. When i asked for another they said they only give one tea cup per room. And when i asked for a towel they brought me one with staines after waiting for two hours. I have to tell u this hotel should be a 2 star. the only plus was the fish i had by the pool. The morning breadfast was the worst i have ever had. There was only pototes and bake beans. No eggs and some silly

Clean room , but furnished with cheap Chinese furniture which may not last long....overall experience was good except for Internet.. Gym and the instructor is excellent. I would reccomend this hotel for a budget business traveller

Wow, just short of words. I will be Specific with their rooms, I am staying in one of their standard rooms and I asked if  a standard room is this beautiful, how will the Delux. Super Delux and Executive look like. Electricity is steady like 24hrs.  Talk of the Ambiance it's very spacious and lightened every where. The pool is of international standard, it's alwyz neat for kids and adult. Security Guaranteed. Just wish my  bizness will alwyz bring me down to Lagos state

If you expect the manager and staff in this place to care about your needs forget it.  The only thing they are interested in is taking your money.  Nightmare! They have no idea about how to run a hotel.  Food on the menu is mostly unavailable and when it is in stock can take 2 hours plus to arrive.   At the breakfast buffet you'd think the staff were paying out of their own pockets so reluctant are they to refill so you can eat.  They just shake their heads and tell you there's none left.   Ask for a refund and they just laugh.   In a room for two they only allow 1 towel and 1 bathrobe.  I coffee sachet and 1 creamer ask for more and it's N1500  more unless you slip the guy some cash!  Just unreal!

Review Title: It's a good hotel, I'd stay here again.
Review Text: I didn't want to choose "average", but the other choice was "very good." This is a good hotel with friendly professional staff, modern comfortable rooms and conveniently close to the airport. Do bear in mind that because you're near the airport there are planes coming into land nearby, but I guess they stop late at night because I didn't have any problems hearing them while sleeping.  There was a rather rowdy crowd of people staying on the floor below me and for some weird reason there are speakers in the passage ways playing rather loud music at night.  The bar is cool and has a pool table. The swimming pool looked lovely, but it was being filled during my stay so didn't have a chance to enjoy it.   It's inside a pretty safe compound and has back up generators. Breakfast was an
Review Text

Hotel rooms are comfortable enough. Room service is slow and they don't seem to know what is on the menu. Descriptions on menu are nothing like what is served! Avoid the hotel buffet at all costs. The Nigerian insistence on cash upfront can be annoying... they have to check with reception to see if you have credit before allowing to sign in the restaurant and for room service.  Twice they delivered room service orders without the bill, but insisted I pay cash... Was also locked out of the room twice for not having topped up my credit with Reception!

Cool Environment Friendly staff Nice Ambience Tasty Food  We also used the Hall for our Wedding reception for our guests. It was wonderful and comfortable. The open space was well adequate for vehicle parking.   Thumbs up for the hotel. Thanks to the Manager...she always willing to help...Chinwe

All facilities on point... Staff well cultured and warmly. Rooms and lobby are all clean with 21st century facilities. The bathrooms are also another site to behold and the Internet ca ciliates too is well appreciated.

Our stay at De Santos Hotel was simply fabulous. The experience there exceeds our expectations considering the location at first. To us, it’s another home away from home experience. The management and staff there went above & beyond to make our stay very comfortable & memorable. Lots of complimentary services; the breakfast buffet, wi-fi, the fitness centre, just to mention but a few.  Though the front gate of the hotel did not in any way portray the true picture or the ambiance of the hotel, wish the management will do something about this, for people to know that such a place exist in that environment. My family & I can't wait to go back any time we’re in Nigeria.!

Family friendly hotel with very good services, nice foods and friendly staff as well. Price is ok even as it is a new place, with brand new quality interior decor. Hotel is right on the express way linking Ikeja, Oshodi or Otta. Like the beautiful party organised for the kids on Children 's Day too! The only downside for us is lack of electricity in the area which means generators have had to be used all the time! Still, will visit the hotel again.

So I and my Fiancé decided to go for a site inspection to see the hall for our wedding reception coming up later this year, the lady that was supposedly supposed to show us the hall and the rooms decided that we weren't worthy enough of seeing the room after keeping us waiting for close to half an hour. We were only allowed to see it on a screen. If I wanted to see it on a screen, I think I would have stayed in my house and checked it out on Google. After getting angry about the poor way she treated us, she also got angry and told us not to teach her her job. Just wow. I didn't expect that from anyone in hospitality. This alone has discouraged us from going there. I mean how are we supposed to want to go back there for anything if we can't even get a proper site inspection.

For lagos, this was a pleasant surprise. I went with family for a 9 day stay during the fuel scarcity saga and not once did the hotel dissapoint when there was no light. the generator came on swiftly. The rooms are spacious and the AC was really cool. the ambiance of the halls, and surrounding areas was really nice, lovely decor, nice music and everywhere was clean. the breakfast buffet though small choices was constantly varied everyday, the only downside was there was no juices and the waiters constantly failed to ensure the burnners was on to warm the food. I made use of the gym and swimming pool and also room service and was peased with the service. can I recommend that they try and add children channels to their TV selection as my kids were not happy that they couldnt find

Positives - Not a bad location. Friendly enough staff. Good security - have police and uniformed guards patrolling the grounds. Clean and tidy. Negatives - Small slection of breakfast items, cold and often runs out. Very poor internet. Poor shower.

Tired of paying European prices for African-quality hotels?  This place is every bit as good as a 3 star hotel in any major European city.  Reasonably convenient to Lagos airport and comfortable rooms.  I tried ordering pasta carbonara on room service and it was actually very good!
